data.name: LblAutoFocusInnerCropRatioTooltip
data.value: If set to a value less than one, star detection during autofocus will only use a centered subframe of the total sensor (if supported by camera). If unsupported by the camera, stars near the edge will be ignored during star detection. If used in combination with a lower than 1 Outer Crop Ratio, a rectangular sliver of the image (between the inner rectangle and the outer rectangle) will be used for autofocus.

data.name: LblAutoFocusMethodTooltip
data.value: When Star HFR is selected, N.I.N.A. will detect stars in the FOV, compute their HFR across multiple focus points, and find the minimum HFR. The Contrast Detection method uses image processing techniques to estimate contrast across multiple focus points, and finds the highest contrast. This method works on terrestrial objects or solar system objects as well, but can be sensitive to noise.

data.name: LblExposureCalculatorDescription
data.value: This tool will suggest a recommended exposure time based on the read noise from your sensor and the average skyglow. If you have SharpCap installed and perform a Sensor Analysis, then use the drop down below to retrieve the read noise and full well capacity for the specified gain. You can also calculate the bias by clicking the Snapshot button next to Bias Mean.

data.name: LblExposureCalculatorMeanLessThanOffset

data.name: LblFileCameraDescription
data.value: This simulated camera will enable the use of cameras which lack an SDK, while still using the whole N.I.N.A. workflow. This simulated camera will watch the specified folder for newly created files. These files will be stored inside an internal queue. Each time the application wants to download an exposure from the camera, the first item of this file queue is resolved and loaded into N.I.N.A. Additionally a manual Bulb Mode trigger can be activated, so it will use the selected Bulb Mode in Settings->Equipment->Camera on Exposure Start. When this trigger is deactivated the application will just skip the Start Exposure and just wait for another file to roll into the specified folder

data.name: LblAbsolute
data.comment: Focuser Backlash Compensation Method to add an absolute value after a focuser direction change

data.name: LblFocuserBacklashMethodTooltip
data.value:
This controls the backlash compensation method used.
Absolute: When the focuser changes directions, an absolute value will be added to the focuser movement. Backlash IN: when the focuser changes from moving outwards to moving inwards the Backlash IN value will be added Backlash OUT: when the focuser changes from moving inwards to moving outwards the Backlash OUT value will be added
Overshoot: This method will compensate for Backlash by overshooting the target position by a large amount and then moving the focuser back to the initially requested position. Due to this compensation the last movement of the focuser will always be in the same direction (either always inwards or always outwards) For Backlash IN and OUT only ONE of these two must be set! When setting IN, the amount will be applied on each inward movement, so the final movement will always be outwards. For Backlash OUT, it will be the other way around.
The method can only be changed when the focuser is not connected!

data.name: LblOvershoot
data.comment: Focuser Backlash Compensation Method by overshooting the position and moving back

data.name: LblDomeScopeUDTooltip
data.value: Measure the height difference (in mm) of the center of the mount axis relative to the base of the dome. For an Alt/Az mount, this is from the center of the Altitude axis, and for an EQ mount this is where the RA and DEC axes intersect. A positive number indicates the center of axis is higher than the base of the dome, and a negative number means it is lower.

When an external application, such as a planetarium or a handset, moves the telescope it may be helpful to wait until the telescope is no longer moving to rotate the dome.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddCondition_Tooltip
data.value: Add a loop condition to the instruction set. An instruction set will be executed and repeated when one or more conditions are added to a container as long as these loop conditions are truthy. Once one of the loop conditions are not truthy anymore, the execution of the remaining instructions inside the set will be skipped. Furthermore loop conditions are valid for the current instruction set and each sub set inside the set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddInstruction_Tooltip
data.value: Add an instruction to the instruction set. An instruction is a single instruction or a set of instructions that will be executed, when they are valid. Instructions that are not valid (indicated by the red circled exclamation mark) will be skipped.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddTrigger_Tooltip
data.value: Add a trigger to the instruction set. Triggers are instructions, that are only executed when the specified parameters to execute them are met. Trigger parameters will be updated and evaluated after an instruction was completed. Furthermore triggers are valid for the current instruction set and each sub set inside the set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Delete_Tooltip
data.value: Removes the current instruction set and all its items from the sequence.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_MoveDown_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction set and all its content down by one position. If the position below it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position below it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved below the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_MoveUp_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction set and all its content up by one position. If the position above it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position above it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved above the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Reset_Tooltip
data.value: Resets the state and progress of the current instruction set and all instructions that are inside.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Delete_Tooltip
data.value: Removes the current instruction from the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_MoveDown_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction down by one position. If the position below it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position below it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved below the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_MoveUp_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction up by one position. If the position above it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position above it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved above the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Rotator_MoveRotatorMechanical_Description
data.value: Moves the rotator to the specified mechanical angle

data.name: LblAutoFocusPointOutsideOfBounds
data.value: Determined focus point position is outside of the overall measurement points of the curve. Fitting is incorrect and autofocus settings most likely incorrect.

data.name: LblAutoFocusCorrelationCoefficientThresholdTooltip
data.value: The minimum R² (Coefficient of determination) value that the selected autofocus fitting has to fulfill for the autofocus run to be considered as successful. The value is in the range between 0-1. When set to 0, the threshold will not be considered. An autofocus run with an R² value above 0.9 can be considered as ideal. However a lower value can still achieve focus in semi ideal conditions. A good starting point for a threshold is a value of 0.8 - anything below that is a questionable fit.

data.name: LblAutoFocusCurveCorrelationCoefficientLow
data.value: Autofocus failed! R² (Coefficient of determination) for curve fitting is below threshold. {0} / {1}
data.comment: First parameter is actual R², second parameter is R² threshold

data.name: LblAutoFocusTrendCorrelationCoefficientLow
data.value: Autofocus failed! R² (Coefficient of determination) for trend line fitting is below threshold. Left: {0} / {2}; Right: {1} / {2}
data.comment: First parameter is actual R² of left trend, second parameter is actual R² of right trend, third parameter is R² threshold

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_SafetyMonitor_WaitUntilSafe_Description
data.value: Waits until Safety Monitor device reports a safe condition

data.name: LblASCOMAllowUnevenPixelDimensionTooltip
data.value: In prior versions of N.I.N.A. the ASCOM driver width & height were always restricted to even numbers, even for mono cameras. When enabled, the application will now allow for the full odd pixel dimension on mono cameras. This setting will have no effect on colour sensors. Only relevant when using an ASCOM camera driver!

data.name: LblPHD2StartGuiding
data.value: PHD2 - Waiting for guiding to start

data.name: LblPHD2StartGuidingTimeoutRetry

data.value: Some mount drivers have a reversed implementation of the primary axis movement. Enable this to reverse the direction on move commands for the primary axis.

data.name: LblSecondaryReversedToolTip
data.value: Some mount drivers have a reversed implementation of the secondary axis movement. Enable this to reverse the direction on move commands for the secondary axis.

data.name: LblDomeShutterDidNotRespond
data.value: Dome did not report shutter movement or failure after completing the request. This is non conformant and dangerous behavior. Please report this to your dome vendor.

data.name: LblDomeCloseShutterStillClosed
data.value: Opening the shutter failed. The shutter status is still reported as closed after initiating open shutter operation.

data.name: LblDomeCloseShutterStillOpen
data.value: Closing the shutter failed. The shutter status is still reported as open after initiating close shutter operation.

data.value: Install via the N.I.N.A. plugin manager or manually download and run the setup from:

data.value: Cancel the check for available online plugins.

data.name: LblPluginCheckForUpdatesTooltip
data.value: Checks the online plugin repository for available plugins and also checks if newer versions of existing plugins exist.

data.name: LblBinAverageEnabledTooltop
data.value: By default, binning is additive. Data are still the same bitness as the camera, so bright pixels can be clipped. Average mode prevents this clipping from taking place at the expense of some dynamic range due to integer division.

data.name: Lbl_Sequencer_AbortToEnd
data.value: Abort and run end of sequence instructions

data.name: Lbl_Sequencer_AbortToEnd_Tooltip
data.value: Interrupts the currently running sequence instruction and skips everything up until the end of sequence instructions to be run

data.name: LblSkipToSequenceEndInstructions
data.value: Skip to end of sequence instructions

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_ErrorBehavior_Tooltip
data.value: Defines how the sequence should continue after all attempts have been unsuccessful to execute the instruction. The default behavior is to continue on errors, however for some instructions it might be desired to not continue with the execution. For example when the center operation fails to frame the target correctly some recovery steps can then be taken.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_NumberOfAttempts_Tooltip
data.value: The number of attempts that should be made when the instruction fails to execute.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_SequenceRootContainer_ResetPrompt
data.value: Do you want to reset the complete sequence run?

data.name: LblDomeDecOffsetHorizontalTooltip
data.value: The horizontal offset of the center of the OTA with respect to the Declination axis (the motor at the base of the fork mount). Positive is "to the right", which is east for the northern hemisphere and west for the southern.

data.name: LblDomeRadiusMisconfigured
data.value: Dome radius not configured properly. The calculated scope position is beyond the dome.

data.name: LblTooltipSwitchTargetSet
data.value: Switches to the simple target set planning mode

data.name: LblSequencerTargetsFolderTooltip
data.value: The folder where sequence targets for the advanced sequencer are stored in

data.name: LblRotatorRangeHalfTooltip
data.value: Half of the mechanical position range is supported. Orientations outside of this range are adjusted 180 degrees to fit within the configured range.

data.name: LblRotatorRangeQuarterTooltip
data.value: 90 degrees of the mechanical position range is supported. This is useful primarily for square sensors. Orientations outside of this range are adjusted to fit within the configured range.

data.name: LblFramingWizardSlewFailed
data.value: Failed to {0} from the framing wizard

data.name: LblUnableToSetMountLatLong
data.value: Unable to set mount latitude to {0} and longitude to {1}!

data.name: LblTrackingASCOMServerStartFailed
data.value: Failed to start tracking CCD ASCOM server. {0}

data.name: LblTrackingASCOMServerEnabledTooltip
data.value: Runs a server in the background to control the built-in tracking camera from other applications

data.name: LblTrackingASCOMServerPipeNameTooltip
data.value: The ASCOM driver that reads from this server should have the same pipe name configured

data.name: LblSBIGUseExternalTrackingCCDChanged
data.value: External Tracking CCD setting changed. Disconnect and reconnect camera for it to take effect.

data.name: LblYourWindowsIsTooOld
data.value: {0} is no longer supported by Microsoft and the N.I.N.A. project. You will encounter application malfunctions or crashes as a result of using N.I.N.A. on an unsupported version of Windows. N.I.N.A.'s current system requirements are listed in the online documentation.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceTrigger_SynchronizeDomeTrigger_Description
data.value: A trigger to limit dome synchronization movements to between sequence steps in order to reduce vibrations during exposures. This should not be used with Dome Following enabled, which runs continuously in the background.

data.name: LblDomeFollowerEnabledError
data.value: Turn dome following off to use the Synchronize Dome Trigger

data.name: Lbl_SequenceCondition_LoopWhileUnsafe_Description
data.value: A condition that checks the connected Safety Monitor device if it is unsafe and loops the instruction set as long as the safety monior reports to be unsafe. If the device returns to be safe the current instruction set is stopped. Best used in conjunction with another loop condition to not end up in an infinite loop when the safety monitor stays unsafe.

data.name: LblFilterChangeResumeGuidingFailed
data.value: Failed to resume guiding after a filter change that caused focuser movement

data.name: LblUnknownInstructionValidation
data.value: Unknown instruction detected! Please double check your sequence and inspect which instructions became invalid. Furthermore validate that everything is up to date.

data.name: LblMirrorLockupDelayTooltip
data.value: The desired length of time between when the mirror is locked up and when the exposure starts. A delay of 0 seconds deactivates this option. The mirror lockup option must be enabled in the camera as well. Refer to your camera's manual for the location of this setting

data.name: LblCanonCameraDisconnected
data.value: {0} has been disconnected from the computer. Check its USB connection and power source

data.name: LblCanonSdkError
data.value: The Canon SDK has experienced an internal error. Unreliable camera operation might result

data.name: Lbl_OldSequencer_ResetTargetRows
data.value: Reset all rows in the current target?

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Platesolving_SolveAndRotate_Description
data.value: Uses platesolving to determine the current rotation of the current position and uses a rotator to get to the specified sky angle. (It will not center the target!)

data.name: LblAnnotateUnlimitedStarsTooltip
data.value: By default, only 200 stars are annotated. If this is enabled, all detected stars are.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_SequenceRootContainer_ClearPrompt
data.value: Do you want to clear the complete sequence run?

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_SequenceRootContainer_Delete_Tooltip
data.value: Deletes all instructions, triggers and conditions from all areas inside the sequence

data.name: LblMountTimeDifferenceTooLarge
data.value: The mount's clock differs from the computer's clock by {0:0} seconds. This may lead to inaccurate pointing and issues with plate solving. Please review your mount's documentation regarding time configuration.

data.name: LblCanonMluNotSupported
data.value: {0} is configured with Mirror Lock-Up (MLU) on, but it does not support MLU exposures via USB. Turn MLU off under the camera's Custom Function menu for exposures to succeed.

data.name: LblQhyUvloActiveError
data.value: The camera is in ultra-low voltage lockout (UVLO) mode to protect its components. This indicates a possible power supply issue. Please contact QHY support for advice on addressing this issue.

data.name: LblDetermineRotationFromCameraCancel
data.value: Cancels to determine rotation from camera for framing.

data.name: LblDetermineRotationFromCameraTooltip
data.value: Takes an image with the camera and starts a plate solve to retrieve the camera orientation. Once successfully solved, the rotation will be set for framing.

data.name: LblScopeCoordinatesTooltip
data.value: Get coordinates from the current scope position

data.name: LblPerDeviceThreadingEnabledTooltip
data.value: This is an experimental setting that may improve UI responsiveness and reduce the chance of UI hangs when connecting to ASCOM drivers. This setting must be enabled before connecting devices for it to have an effect. Please share feedback with the contributors in Discord if you use this, since we're considering enabling this for everyone.

data.name: LblNikonX86Deprecated
data.value: Not supported - Nikon no longer distributes SDK binaries for x86 applications

data.name: LblPluginUpdateAllTooltip
data.value: Updates all plugins where an update is available to the latest version

data.name: LblMeridianFlipRetry

data.name: LblMeridianFlipRetryFailed
data.value: Failed to slew for meridian flip after maximum number of retries. Aborting.

data.name: LblROI
data.comment: Region of interest used for sub frame.

data.name: LblROIPercentageTooltip
data.value: Region of Interest expressed in percentage relative to the center

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Imaging_TakeSubframeExposure_Description
data.value: Takes an exposure for the given duration, gain and offset for the specified region of interest

data.name: LblPreserveAlignmentTooltip
data.value: Having this option enabled will ensure that the panels align to a single rectangular panel, but will result in different rotation angles for each panel. This option should be enabled when automatic camera rotation is available or when manual rotation of the camera is possible for each mosaic panel.

data.name: LblRotateSkyTooltip
data.value: When enabled, the sky background will be rotated instead of the rectangle.

data.name: LblUpdateExistingTargetInSequencerTooltip
data.value: When clicked it will show a list of targets that were already placed inside the sequencer. After clicking one of these targets that target will be updated with the currently framed name, coordinates and rotation. This button is not visible when in mosaic mode.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Disable_Tooltip
data.value: Disables the current instruction. A disabled instruction will not run during sequence execution.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Enable_Tooltip
data.value: Enables the current instruction, to be considered again to run during sequence execution.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_DisableEnable_Tooltip
data.value: Disables or enables the current instruction set and all its content.
